intro: Chaerophyllum reflexum var. reflexum, commonly known as the reflexed chaerophyllum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
